title: [BUG] Error for mlflow models build-docker

labels.name: area/docker
labels.description: Docker use anywhere, such as MLprojects and MLmodels

body:
**Please fill in this bug report template to ensure a timely and thorough response.**

### Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages bug fix contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute a fix for this bug to the MLflow code base?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.
- [ ] Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [x] No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: no
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Linux 5.10.15-1-MANJARO
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: binary (`pip install`)
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: mlflow, version 1.14.0
- **Python version**: Python 3.8.8
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**: --
- **Exact command to reproduce**: `mlflow models build-docker -m "models:/MY_EXPERIMENT_NAME/Production" -n "mlflow-test-docker-image-model"` (replace MY_EXPERIMENT_NAME)

### Describe the problem

During the last step of the `mlflow models build-docker` command (step 17 of 17), the following error occurs:

```
Step 17/17 : ENTRYPOINT ["python", "-c", "from mlflow.models import container as C; C._serve()"]
 ---> Running in 654d293b33eb
Removing intermediate container 654d293b33eb
 ---> 4555f8ea4314
Successfully built 4555f8ea4314
Successfully tagged mlflow-test-docker-image-model:latest
Exception ignored in: <function Connection.__del__ at 0x7f8000ccc4c0>
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/julius/anaconda3/envs/mlflow/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pysftp/__init__.py", line 1013, in __del__
  File "/home/julius/anaconda3/envs/mlflow/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pysftp/__init__.py", line 785, in close
  File "/home/julius/anaconda3/envs/mlflow/lib/python3.8/site-packages/paramiko/sftp_client.py", line 195, in close
  File "/home/julius/anaconda3/envs/mlflow/lib/python3.8/site-packages/paramiko/channel.py", line 671, in close
  File "/home/julius/anaconda3/envs/mlflow/lib/python3.8/site-packages/paramiko/transport.py", line 1846, in _send_user_message
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'time'
```

**Importantly, the docker image is built successfully nevertheless. It is shown by `docker images` and can also be started with `docker run -p 5001:8080 "mlflow-test-docker-image-model"`. Also, the server successfully serves the model as tested with `
curl -d '{"columns":\["x"\], "data":\[\[1\], \[-1\]\]}' -H 'Content-Type: application/json; format=pandas-split' -X POST localhost:5001/invocations`.**

Also, maybe of relevance, serving the model with an anaconda environment works flawlessly.

### Code to reproduce issue
Provide a reproducible test case that is the bare minimum necessary to generate the problem.

- go to `mlflow/examples/sklearn_logistic_regression`
- (using remote sftp tracking server, so I set: `export MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=http://127.0.0.1:4000`
- set experiment name with: `export MLFLOW_EXPERIMENT_NAME=MY_EXPERIMENT_NAME`
- `mlflow run .`
- `mlflow models build-docker -m "models:/MY_EXPERIMENT_NAME/Production" -n "mlflow-test-docker-image-model"`

### What component(s), interfaces, languages, and integrations does this bug affect?
Components 
- [x] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging
- [x] `area/build`: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages
- [x] `area/examples`: Example code
- [x] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for Model Registry
- [x] `area/models`: MLmodel format, model serialization/deserialization, flavors
- [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends
- [ ] `area/scoring`: Local serving, model deployment tools, spark UDFs
- [x] `area/server-infra`: MLflow server, JavaScript dev server
- [x] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

Interface 
- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, JavaScript, plotting
- [x] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
- [ ] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry
- [ ] `area/windows`: Windows support

Language 
- [ ] `language/r`: R APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/new`: Proposals for new client languages

Integrations
- [ ] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations
- [ ] `integrations/sagemaker`: SageMaker integrations
- [ ] `integrations/databricks`: Databricks integrations
